intro: Nirbisia codua, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking blue to purple tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Nirbisia codua is valued in horticulture for its ornamental beauty and ability to attract pollinators.
